Articles.Content: Planets maybe (wandering stars)?
Subatomic particles?
feelings? and darn this one is hard

Planets maybe (wandering stars)?

No, but I like that.

Subatomic particles?

Negative.

feelings? and darn this one is hard

No, and I get the impression you're not the only one who's feeling that way.
It's BEES!
I do believe that Majorjim hit the nail on the head.

It's BEES!
I do believe that Majorjim hit the nail on the head.

He did indeed.

Always changing, never the same, -- A colony of bees is constantly moving.

But always one in nature and name, -- A colony of bees is one name. And it's natural.

Always wandering, always collecting -- Worker bees are always wandering, collecting nectar intentionally, pollen unintentionally

But never travelling, and never detecting -- A beehive doesn't move (and never detecting runs on to the next line)

What their true importance is to us all, -- They don't know how important they are by pollinating plants

For without them, even the mighty could fall, -- Well they say if bees went extinct, plants would start dying out, and most land-based animal life might too, but how true that is, I'm not sure. Hence could and not would.

They all have their lives, they all have a quest, -- They live. They survive.

But one of their number is more than the rest. -- The Queen Bee.

Their movement defies the laws of nature, -- Bees wings appear too small for their bodies. Ultra-high speed cameras show they move their wings in a unique way to get more lift. Rather like an infini-glider (no, not really...)

Never knowingly make them hate-yer. -- Because you might get stung.

EDIT: So it's Majorjim next

When I read MajorJim's comment, I checked the riddle and I thought to myself, You know, he's right.

Very well done.

(Also, damn, how did I not think of that!)

I feel ya. I was thinking it was some sort of physiological thing since animals were deemed wrong. (But I guess that's what happens when you sleep in all the time.)

I do believe that Majorjim hit the nail on the head.

Woohoo! My first correct answer! It was "But one of their number is more than the rest" That convinced me it was a Bee hive.

I enjoyed that.

^^ Make with the new riddle, Majorjim!

^^ Make with the new riddle, Majorjim!

I'm sorry guys I didn't know I had to write one if I won.

Can I nominate someone? I cant write decent riddles..

I feel ya. I was thinking it was some sort of physiological thing since animals were deemed wrong. (But I guess that's what happens when you sleep in all the time.)

Yeah, "animals" wasn't specific enough. So I made sure I worded my "no" in such a way that the word animals was wrong, without saying animals were wrong.

<snip> but the answer is not animals

EDIT: Majorjim, I've not been here long, but as far as I can tell, what usually happens if the person who won the riddle doesn't want to write one or takes too long about it, someone else can post one. It doesn't have to be really difficult though. It doesn't even have to rhyme.

Edited February 2, 2015 by TheMoonRover

It doesn't have to be really difficult though. It doesn't even have to rhyme.

The previous riddles have been very well written. It would just be embarrassing. So I leave it to whom ever has one in their mind.

The previous riddles have been very well written. It would just be embarrassing. So I leave it to whom ever has one in their mind.

A quick one liner is fine. We're not all poets in here.

A quick one liner is fine. We're not all poets in here.

OK..

You find me at the end. Except when you don't. What am I?
a period i think

a period i think

LOL, if my US to UK translation is correct, then you are correct my friend. Yup, its a full stop.

First try! well done B787_300! Phew.. Now someone can write a proper one!

Phew.. Now someone can write a proper one!

Well, I didn't answer quickly enough, but I guess I could give another one so everyone can have time to come up with their own.

Running without legs

Screaming without voice

Slicing without knives

All without choice

Howls without ring

Rumbles without quake

For to hear one sing

Is to die in its' wake

What is it?

I see what you mean, MoonRover. This is ridiculous.
Water? 10chars

Water? 10chars

A pretty good first guess (although I've never heard of water shaking the ground beneath it. Or for that mater, and individual water)

You're actually in the ballpark, but not the correct answer.

Edited February 2, 2015 by Xannari Ferrows
Wind? ie a tornado?

Wind? ie a tornado?

Sadly, no. Try again! (Remember: water is a decent first guess; what does it sound like?) Oh god I'm probably giving away the answer like that, but whatever.

(although I will admit, tornado fits pretty well, but falls apart at the 3rd to last line)

Something I need to mention. The answer is a little more specific than a generalized answer, so it may be a bit harder to find if you think in generals. Try to think specific phenomenon! (Oops, did I just give it away?)
